intro: Pilea alongensis, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a popular houseplant native to China. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are thick and glossy, often resembling small coins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Pilea alongensis is known for its ease of care and ability to propagate through stem cuttings.
